page.title: 16Poltergeist of Byron St
page.content: Ellen Whittle was born in 1893. She lived at No.1 Byron St.for 15 years before the trouble started.After darkness a poltergeist was said to have taken over.In fits of temper it would hurl wardrobes across the room, rip up carpets and destroy furniture. Ellen Whittle survived two months of these terrifying experiences before her death on the 22nd of October.That evening she was walking along the edge of a nearby disused quarry,when she fell to her death. No one has proved any conection between her death and the poltergeist. Various scientists and experts were called in to investigate the occurences and their verdict was that it was genuine.However the usual features of a poltergeist were not found i.e.no small naughty child,few noises and no motive for a hoax!
